message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CL, cs.MM 

Reasoning: The paper focuses on the problem of object recognition in computer vision, which is a core topic in the cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) sub-category. The paper also introduces a new learning framework called LUPI, which involves incorporating privileged information during training, making it relevant to the cs.LG (Machine Learning) sub-category. The paper also discusses the use of maximum-margin techniques for binary and multiclass object classification, which falls under the cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) sub-category. Additionally, the paper explores the use of attributes, bounding boxes, and image tags as sources of privileged information, which are topics commonly studied in the cs.CL (Computation and Language) sub-category. Finally, the paper conducts user studies to understand human learning, which is relevant to the cs.MM (Multimedia) sub-category.
